title: Natural Logarithm Antiderivatives
text: Let $$f(x)=\ln(|x|)$$. for $$x>0$$, $$f(x)=ln(x)$$ and $$\frac{d}{dx} lnx=\frac{1}{x}$$. For $$x<0$$, $$f(x)=ln(-x)$$ and $$\frac{d}{dx} \operatorname{lnnegneg}\left(x\right)=\frac{-1}{-x}=\frac{1}{x}$$.
speech: Let  f of x is equal to the natural log of, parentheses, the absolute value of x  . for  x is greater than 0 ,  f of x, is equal to l n of x,  and  fraction, d over, d x,  l n x is equal to 1 over x, . For  x, is less than 0 ,  f of x, is equal to l n negative x,  and  fraction, d over, d x,  lnnegneg of x is equal to, fraction, negative 1, over, negative x,  is equal to 1 over x .

title: Adding Constants
text: Make sure to add "+C" after your intial antiderivative to account for the unknown constant.
speech: Make sure to add "+C" after your intial antiderivative to account for the unknown constant.
